item.title: Project 1
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

item.title: Python
item.description: x=["apple", "banana", "carrot", "dog", "eggplant", ] library(reticulate) py$x ## [1] "apple" "banana" "carrot" "dog" "eggplant" head(women) ## height weight ## 1 58 115 ## 2 59 117 ## 3 60 120 ## 4 61 123 ## 5 62 126 ## 6 63 129 y <- women r.y>60 ## height weight ## 0 False True ## 1 False True ## 2 False True ## 3 True True ## 4 True True ## 5 True True ## 6 True True ## 7 True True ## 8 True True ## 9 True True ## 10 True True ## 11 True True ## 12 True True ## 13 True True ## 14 True True import re string1="We have to extract these numbers 12, 47, 48 The integers numbers are also interesting: 189 2036 314\',\' is a separator, so please extract these numbers 125,789,1450 and also these 564,90456 We like to offer you 7890$ per month in order to complete this task.
